sn9.5:1.1: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.5:1.2: Now at that time Ānanda was spending too much time informing the lay people.
sn9.5:1.3: Then the deity haunting that forest had compassion for Ānanda, wanting what’s best for him. So they approached him wanting to stir him up, and recited these verses:
sn9.5:2.1: “You’ve left for the jungle, the root of a tree,
sn9.5:2.3: Practice absorption, Gotama, don’t be negligent!
sn9.5:2.4: What is this hullabaloo to you?”
sn9.5:3.1: Impelled by that deity, Venerable Ānanda was struck with a sense of urgency.
